metadata.title: CVE-2021-47394 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: nf_tables: unlink table before deleting it syzbot reportsfollowing UAF: BUG: KASAN: use-after-free in memcmp+0x18f/0x1c0lib/string.c:955 nla_strcmp+0xf2/0x130 lib/nlattr.c:836nft_table_lookup.part.0+0x1a2/0x460 net/netfilter/nf_tables_api.c:570nft_table_lookup net/netfilter/nf_tables_api.c:4064 [inline]nf_tables_getset+0x1b3/0x860 net/netfilter/nf_tables_api.c:4064nfnetlink_rcv_msg+0x659/0x13f0 net/netfilter/nfnetlink.c:285netlink_rcv_skb+0x153/0x420 net/netlink/af_netlink.c:2504 Problem is thatall get operations are lockless, so the commit_mutex held bynft_rcv_nl_event() isn't enough to stop a parallel GET request from doingread-accesses to the table object even after synchronize_rcu(). To avoidthis, unlink the table first and store the table objects in on-stackscratch space.

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gcp-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
